So, yeah, it does report lots of your interactions with the game but nothing I'd be much concerned about. I still block the tracking connections, though

 I still block the tracking connections, though

How? Asking for a friend

18 minutes ago, Dafni said:

How? Asking for a friend

I added the names of unity tracking hosts to my /etc/hosts file (might work under Windows, too, but the file is in a different location).

See this post by Snark:

4 hours ago, Dafni said:

How? Asking for a friend

In case you are OK with blocking the whole game from connecting to the net, then

Linux:  iptables -A OUTPUT -m owner --uid-owner {USERNAME} -j REJECT

Windows: just block the program accessing the net.
